title: The Problem of Induction: Hume's Bombshell
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Problem of Induction: Hume's Bombshell.

hook.text: The sun has risen every day for 4.5 billion years. Can you prove it will rise tomorrow? David Hume said no.

buildup.text: In 1739, Hume argued that past patterns can never logically guarantee future events.

twist.text: It's circular: we trust induction because it worked before â€” which is itself an inductive argument.

climax.text: No philosopher has ever fully solved the problem of induction. We just trust it because it works.

punchline.text: Science's foundation has no foundation. It just works.

quiz.question: What did Hume argue about induction?
options: Past patterns can't logically guarantee future events
